page.title: 14Local History.
page.content: On Ffynnon Gynydd Common can be found {St.Cynidr's Well.}St.Cynidr was the first man to bring Christianity to the area. It is said that Oliver Cromwell's troops stopped to water their horses at the well.This is the only time the well has been dry. Today there is a wooden shelter over the well erected in memory of Walter Fenwick DeWinton of Maesllwch Castle who was killed in action in South Africa.The inscription reads "Draw water from the well of Salvation." (Isaiah chapt.12 verse 3.) {Superstition. } Superstition has grown up around the well.It is said that a woman wishing to have a child must go to the well, make a wish,and wait to see a bubble rise.If this happens,she will soon have a child.
